marketNews.title: IHSG rose +1.65%, DOID Bought Coking Coal Mine for US$455 Million. News compilation for today.
marketNews.content: IHSG rose +1.65%, DOID Bought Coking Coal Mine for US$455 Million. News compilation for today. 25 November 2024

marketNews.title: Elections and Policy Discussion on Tax Amnesty and Housing Subsidies
marketNews.content: President-elect of the US, Donald Trump, on Friday (11/22) said that he would nominate Scott Bessent as US treasury secretary. Bessent spent his career in finance, having worked for George Soros and Jim Chanos before running his own hedge fund. Reuters reported that Bessent is a supporter of tax reform and deregulation, with some analysts seeing his appointment as potentially reducing the likelihood of high import tariffs as mooted by Trump. Kontan reported that the plan for the 3rd tax amnesty rule will not be much different from the previous tax amnesty rules in 2016-2017 and 2022. Kontan sources in parliament said that this 3rd tax amnesty will target shadow economy activities, namely legal and illegal economic activities that are not reported for tax purposes. On the other hand, tax observer from the Center for Indonesia Taxation Analysis, Fajry Akbar, doubted that shadow economy actors will want to participate in the tax amnesty. Therefore, Fajry asked the government and DPR to scrap the tax amnesty discourse because it has the potential to create moral hazard and can damage the government's image and credibility. The government on Monday (11/25) officially abolished the Land and Building Rights Acquisition Fee (BPHTB) and Building Permit Approval (PBG) for low-income communities. This policy aims to curb housing prices and accelerate the realization of the 3 million homes per year program.

marketNews.title: IDX Considers Higher IPO Proceeds Criteria for Listing and Efforts to Lower Airfare Prices
marketNews.content: IDX Director, Iman Rachman, said that the exchange is considering minimum IPO proceeds requirements as part of efforts to overhaul listing rules. Iman mentioned that the IDX has begun to encourage companies with equity over 2 trillion Rupiah to ensure that their IPO proceeds are at least 10% of the total company valuation, instead of the current minimum 10% free float. Iman stated that this plan to change the rule is being discussed with the OJK and is likely to be approved in early 2025. The IDX's plan to revise listing rules emerged after FTSE Russell removed Barito Renewables Energy (BREN) from its index inclusion plan in September 2024 due to high shareholder concentration. Kontan reported that the Aircraft Ticket Price Reduction Task Force is planning 3 new incentives to suppress air ticket prices, namely: 1) cutting the fuel surcharge for jet aircraft from 10% to 2% during December 19, 2024-January 3, 2025; 2) cutting the fuel surcharge for propeller aircraft from 25% to 20% during December 19, 2024-January 3, 2025; and 3) not increasing jet fuel prices throughout December 2024 or providing a discount of 7.5-10%. The plan for these 3 incentives is in addition to the incentive of cutting airport passenger service charges by 50% during December 19, 2024-January 3, 2025. The Task Force hopes these incentives can reduce air ticket prices by 10-13% during the Christmas and New Year (Nataru) period.

marketNews.title: Developed Countries Commit to at Least US$300 Billion Annually for Climate Financing
marketNews.content: Wealthy nations on Sunday (11/24) committed to raising at least US$300 billion per year for climate financing in developing countries, based on the agreement from the United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP29). This amount is an increase compared to the current commitment of US$100 billion per year which will end in 2025, but is still far from the demand from developing countries which require climate financing worth US$1.3 trillion by 2035.

tickerNews.title: BBRI's October 2024 Net Profit Decreased YoY and MoM, Driven by Rising Credit Cost and Lowered NIM
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) recorded a net profit (bank only) of 4.1 trillion Rupiah (-8.2% YoY, -26% MoM) in October 2024, bringing the bank only net profit for 10M24 to 45.7 trillion Rupiah (+5.3% YoY). On the negative side, credit cost (CoC) increased again and Net Interest Margin (NIM) decreased. Meanwhile, on the positive side, operating expenses (opex) remained under control. CoC Increased Again: After showing improvement in the last 2 months, BBRI's CoC (bank only) in October 2024 rose again to 3.15% (+131 bps YoY, +38 bps MoM), although not as high as the CoC in May and July 2024 at 3.8-3.9%. This result caused the CoC for 10M24 to increase to 3.19% (vs. 10M23: 2.57%), worse than management's consolidated FY24 guidance aiming for a maximum of 3%. The increase in CoC was accompanied by a growth in provision expenses in October 2024 to 3.2 trillion Rupiah (+83% YoY, +15% MoM), resulting in provision expenses for 10M24 reaching 31.6 trillion Rupiah (+36% YoY). The increase in provision expenses in October 2024 weighed down the monthly net profit, considering that operationally, Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) (bank only) still reached 8.5 trillion Rupiah (+19% YoY, -11% MoM). NIM Weakened: BBRI's NIM (bank only) in October 2024 fell to 6.28% (-12 bps YoY, -20 bps MoM), after experiencing an increasing trend in previous months. This result caused BBRI's NIM for 10M24 to drop to 6.34% (vs. 10M23: 6.73%). The decrease in NIM during 10M24 occurred along with a shift to an asset mix with smaller yields, with placements at Bank Indonesia increasing +17% YoY during 10M24 while placements in securities (including government bonds) decreased -8.6% YoY. Efficiency Maintained: On the other hand, BBRI was still able to maintain its operational efficiency trend with opex decreasing to 5.4 trillion Rupiah (-2.8% YoY, +19% MoM) in October 2024, driven by lower labor costs. During 10M24, opex only grew +4.4% YoY to 48.6 trillion Rupiah, which helped PPOP increase by +15% YoY to 89.5 trillion Rupiah. Key Takeaway: Although CoC increased again in October 2024, we tend to wait and see to determine whether this is more due to the company's front-loading causing CoC to normalize by year-end, or if it is a sign of deteriorating asset quality. Furthermore, market concerns about BBRI also focus on the performance of its subsidiary, PT Permodalan Nasional Madani, whose performance cannot be seen from the bank only performance.

tickerNews.title: DOID's Subsidiary Signs Agreement to Acquire 51% Stake in Dawson Complex Coking Coal Mine for US$455 Million
tickerNews.content: Delta Dunia Makmur (DOID) through its business entity, PT Bukit Makmur Internasional (BUMA International), signed a purchase agreement for a 51% stake in the Dawson Complex metallurgical coal (coking coal) mine worth 455 million US dollars from Peabody Energy Corporation (NYSE: BTU). The Dawson Complex is one of the largest metallurgical coal assets in Australia, with a resource life of more than 50 years. This transaction is part of Anglo American's (LON: AAL) divestment of its remaining metallurgical coal assets to Peabody Energy, where Peabody Energy will only transfer the Dawson Complex to BUMA International after finalizing the transaction with Anglo American.

tickerNews.title: MDIY Plans IPO to Raise IDR 4.2-4.7 Trillion, Primarily for Debt Repayment
tickerNews.content: MR.D.I.Y operator, Daya Intiguna Yasa (MDIY), plans to hold an IPO of 2.5 billion shares (10%) with an offering price of around 1,650-1,870 Rupiah per share, potentially raising funds of about 4.2-4.7 trillion Rupiah. The proceeds will be used 60% for debt payment, 30% for opening new stores for its subsidiary, and 10% for company working capital. Of the total shares offered, approximately 2.3 billion (9%) shares belong to MDIY's controller, Azara Alpina Sdn. Bhd., while the remainder are new shares. The public offering is scheduled for December 13-17, 2024, with a listing schedule on December 19, 2024. In 1H24, MDIY recorded a net profit of 532 billion Rupiah (+228% YoY), with revenue of 3.2 trillion Rupiah (+93% YoY) and same store sales growth (SSSG) of +11% YoY. The company's total number of stores reached 824 outlets (+41% YoY) as of 1H24, with store contributions outside Java reaching 60% of the total stores.

tickerNews.title: ADRO Announces Cum Date Indication for Share Public Offering (PUPS) for AADI on November 26, 2024
tickerNews.content: Adaro Energy Indonesia (ADRO) announced that the indication schedule for the cum date of the share public offering by shareholders (PUPS) for Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI) falls on November 26, 2024, with an estimated PUPS exercise period on December 6-10, 2024. The estimated electronic share distribution period is scheduled for December 9-11, 2024.

tickerNews.title: PGAS Reports Gas Sales Volume Below Target for 10M24, While Transmission Volume Exceeds Target
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS) recorded a gas sales volume of 853 BBtud (-8% YoY) during 10M24, which is -11% lower than management's 2024 target. Of this amount, 54% was contributed by specific natural gas price users (HGBT), while the rest was from non-HGBT. Meanwhile, gas transmission volume reached 1,529 MMSCFD (+5% YoY) during 10M24, which is +1% higher than management's 2024 target. Natural gas sales volume (LNG) reached 62 BBtud (+100% YoY) during 10M24, which is -51% lower than management's 2024 target.

tickerNews.title: ENRG Successfully Renegotiates Sengkang Block Gas Price from US$5.08/BBtud to US$6/BBtud and Bentu Block Price from 10% to 10.75% of ICP
tickerNews.content: Deputy President Director of Energi Mega Persada (ENRG), Eduardus Ardianto, stated that the company has renegotiated several oil and gas (migas) sales contracts with the company's customers. Eduardus mentioned that the renegotiation successfully increased the selling price of gas in the Sengkang Block from 5.08 US dollars per BBtud to 6 US dollars per BBtud, with sales volume also increasing, although Eduardus did not provide further details. Contract renegotiations were also signed for the gas price in the Bentu Block, changing from 10% of Indonesia Crude Price (ICP) to 10.75% of ICP.

tickerNews.title: ERAL Announces Agreement to Acquire 51% Stake in JDFI and 49% Stake in JDFD from JD Sports Fashion Plc
tickerNews.content: Sinar Eka Selaras (ERAL) announced that it has signed a purchase agreement for a 51% stake in PT JDSports Fashion Indonesia (JDFI) and a 49% stake in PT JDSports Fashion Distribution (JDFD) from JD Sports Fashion Plc. (LON: JD). The total transaction value has not been announced. Following this transaction, ERAL's ownership in JDFI and JDFD increases to 99.9% respectively, meaning JDFI and JDFD will be consolidated into ERAL's financial statements.

tickerNews.title: LEAD Targets US$2.4 Million Net Profit in FY24, Reversing FY23 Net Loss, Confirms Shareholder Approval for Debt Conversion via Private Placement
tickerNews.content: Secretary of Logindo Samudramakmur (LEAD), Denny Haryanto, stated that the company targets a net profit of US$2.4 million for FY24, reversing a net loss of US$5.4 million in FY23. Denny mentioned that ship charter demand and the Rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar will influence the realization of FY24 net profit, as some ship charters use the Rupiah currency. LEAD has received approval from shareholders to conduct a private placement worth 325.5 billion Rupiah at the end of November 2024 to convert debt into shares.

tickerNews.title: KETR Clarifies Main Shareholders Plan to Seek Potential Investors, No Corporate Action Planned in Next 3 Months
tickerNews.content: Ketrosden Triasmitra (KETR) stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company's main shareholders plan to seek potential investors who have a positive synergy with the company's business. Nevertheless, KETR stated that the company has no plans to undertake corporate action for at least the next 3 months.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Injects IDR 53.4 Billion Capital into Subsidiary DSS for Fiber-to-the-Home (FTTH) Business
tickerNews.content: Solusi Sinergi Digital (WIFI) announced that it has injected capital amounting to 53.4 billion Rupiah to its subsidiary, PT Dharma Sinar Semesta (DSS). DSS is a WIFI subsidiary operating in the fiber-to-the-home (FTTH) sector.

tickerNews.title: ABMM via Subsidiary CKB Signs Agreement to Acquire 99.9% of Two CTBN Subsidiaries for Logistics Business Development
tickerNews.content: ABM Investama (ABMM) through its subsidiary, PT Cipta Krida Bahari (CKB), announced that it has signed a purchase agreement for a 99.9% stake in 2 subsidiaries of Citra Tubindo (CTBN), namely PT Sarana Citranusa Kabil (SCN) and PT Citra Pembina Pengangkutan Industries (CPPI). The total transaction value has not been announced. This transaction is intended to develop ABMM's logistics business.

tickerNews.title: PPRI Director Dilon Sutandar Sells 30 Million Shares for Approx. IDR 3.5 Billion, Reducing Stake to 21.86%
tickerNews.content: Director of Paperocks Indonesia (PPRI), Dilon Sutandar, sold 30 million PPRI shares at an average price of 116.3 Rupiah per share on November 21, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 3.5 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, Dilon Sutandar's ownership in PPRI decreased from 24.65% to 21.86%.
